title: The Major Leagues Arrive in Colombia
summary: Bogota – On July 5, Citibank Colombia and Cititrust, the management company, in association with BlackRock, began operations of the first exchange traded fund in the Colombian public exchange market. BlackRock, considered the world's largest exchange traded funds manager, will act as the professional manager for the ETF. iShares COLCAP began trading today in the Colombian Stock Exchange (BVC).
tag-1: The Major Leagues Arrive in Colombia
tag-3: Bogota – On July 5, Citibank Colombia and Cititrust, the management company, in association with BlackRock, began operations of the first exchange traded fund in the Colombian public exchange market. BlackRock, considered the world's largest exchange traded funds manager, will act as the professional manager for the ETF. iShares COLCAP began trading today in the Colombian Stock Exchange (BVC).
tag-4: The new fund is based on the COLCAP index, which is designed and managed by the BVC, and shows the performance of the top-20 liquid shares in the Colombian market – seeking to emulate the yields of that index.
tag-5: Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs) are those specially designed to track the performance of a specific index, offering investors an efficient and low-cost alternative to buying or selling a portfolio's stake that includes bonds, shares or commodities in a single operation. ETFs have seen a major growth at a global level. The current size, growth and liquidity of these kinds of funds show the increasing interest of investors in this new product.
tag-6: Citi globally handles ETFs, as well as in the Brazilian and Mexican markets. For the iShares COLCAP fund in particular, Citi Colombia, through Cititrust, offers fund-management services including custody, accounting, valuation, reporting and investors' registration, among others.
tag-7: "We are pleased with the partnership between Citi and BlackRock; they have worked together on the development of the legal framework that makes possible the ETFs' arrival to Colombia," said Juan Pablo Cordoba, president of BVC. "Thanks to BlackRock's global experience on ETF management, and Citi's presence and knowledge of the local market, we have the necessary infrastructure to operate the first Exchange Traded Fund in the country."
tag-8: Cititrust Colombia has established itself as a market expert in the businesses of custody, fund management and value-added services that Citi offers investors worldwide in 163 countries through global platforms. These platforms feature modular and open architecture, allowing clients to have fully-automated processes to operate in global markets. In this business, at a global level, with more than $13 trillion assets under custody and the industry's largest proprietary network, clients can leverage Citi's local market expertise and global reach to extract value across the entire investment value chain.
tag-9: "It is very satisfying for us to have been chosen by BVC and our partners at BlackRock in the development of the first ETF in the country," said Bernardo Noreña, CCO Citibank Colombia. "We constantly look to bring innovative financial products and services to markets where we do business, resting on our extended local and global experience that allows us to support the growth in the capital market."

tag-12: iShares iShares is the global product leader in exchange traded funds with over 460 funds globally across equities, fixed income and commodities, which trade on 19 exchanges worldwide. The iShares Funds are bought and sold like common stocks on securities exchanges. The iShares Funds are attractive to many individual and institutional investors and financial intermediaries because of their relative low cost and trading flexibility. Investors can purchase and sell shares through any brokerage firm, financial advisor, or online broker, and hold the funds in any type of brokerage account. The iShares customer base consists of the institutional segment of pension plans and fund managers, as well as the retail segment of financial advisors and high net worth individuals.
tag-13: Carefully consider the iShares Funds' investment objectives, risk factors, and charges and expenses before investing. This and other relevant information can be found in the Funds' prospectuses, which may be obtained at www.iShares.com.co. Please read the Terms & Conditions and prospectus carefully before investing.
tag-14: Investing involves risk, including possible loss of principal. Transactions in shares of the iShares Funds will result in brokerage commissions and will generate tax consequences. Shares of the iShares Funds may be sold throughout the day on the exchange through any brokerage account. However, shares may only be redeemed directly from a Fund by Authorized Participants, in very large creation/redemption units.

tag-16: BVC The "Bolsa de Valores de Colombia" ("BVC") is multiproduct exchange that collects the legacy from more than 80 years of stock market history in Colombia. In July of 2001 the exchanges of Bogota, Cali and Medellin were integrated to create a single Exchange, since then the BVC has administrated the capital market in Colombia. In July of 2007 BVC became a public listed company. BVC is recognized as an exemplary and innovative firm that has achieved high quality standards in the administration of the trading platforms for Equities, Fixed Income, Derivatives and Currencies, and also the OTC systems for Fixed Income and Currencies. Today, the BVC is moving forward with the market internationalization project, and is part, with Bolsa de Comercio de Santiago and Bolsa de Valores de Lima, of the Latin America Integrated Market MILA. For further information visit www.bvc.com.co.
